subject: Vam Pro Kit
description_text:
Dear Sir or Madam,
I am very interested in purchasing the VAM PRO 2-piece kit for my BJ simracing pedals. I'd like to adapt them to my pedals, but I am unsure which control box module I need to buy. I would appreciate your help so I can complete my purchase as soon as possible.
Additionally, I need the order to be shipped to Chile. I am willing to buy it either from your website or through your official store on AliExpress.
Thank you very much, and I look forward to your response.

conversations.body_text: Hi Leo Bavaud,     It should also be a 4P4C RJ11 connector. You may need to re-crimp the connector, though the current one might still work. Most local computer shops can help with re-crimping. Alternatively, you can take a clear photo of the connector’s wiring sequence and send it to me for confirmation.   https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51351053533498

Hi,

I hope this email finds you well.

I'm writing because I'm a bit confused about the cable situation. If I buy
the kit and the Control Box you sent, can I connect the VAMs to the Control
Box and then connect the Control Box to my PC via USB, completely
independent of my pedals? Is it a simple plug-and-play setup?

Any help you can provide to clarify this would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time.

Best regards,
Leandro.

Hi Leo Bavaud,  Yes, theoretically you no longer need your previous control box — you can simply use our control box and software.

Hello there,

I hope this email finds you well.

Why do you say that I don't need the previous control box?

Let me explain how I would like to connect the pedals.

I would like to connect my Bj pedals to their control box so they function
as they originally did.

 I would then connect your VAM pedals to the separate control box you
provided to use with either SimHub or your software.

This would allow both devices to be connected, each to its own control box,
and remain completely independent.

Is this possible?

Thank you for your time and apologies for all the emails.

Best regards,

Leandro

Regarding the purchase, is it possible to ship to Chile directly from your

Thank you again for your help.

It may be compatible with your current BJ pedal RJ connector, although you might not necessarily need it, since it mainly handles telemetry data and vibration signals.    https://www.simsonn.com/products/simsonn-vam-pedals-haptic-reactor?variant=51351053533498
